intro: Erycibe brassii, commonly known as the purple star hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its large, showy purple bracts that surround small yellow flowers, giving it a striking appearance. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface depending on the variety.
